s2.message: Adblock Plus is an open-source, community driven project. There are many ways for you to contribute to the project.

s5.message: Adblock Plus is a community driven open-source project that aims to make the internet better for everyone by purging bad ads.

s6.message: Please support us if you like using it.

s17.message: While nobody profits directly from it, widespread adoption of ad blocking software will make intrusive ads economically inefficient until they become as rare as pop-up windows already are today.

s18.message: And aside from making the internet a better place it is simply good to know that this work is used.

s19.message: There are many ways how you can help our cause by making Adblock Plus more popular:

s20.message: Follow us on Twitter, Facebook or Google+ and recommend ABP to all your friends.

s21.message: If Adblock Plus has improved your browsing experience, share this in your blog or on social networks.

s22.message: Convince your employer or university to install Adblock Plus.

s23.message: Approach your local media to report about privacy and security on the internet.

s25.message: If you notice that Adblock Plus isn't behaving the way you think it should — tell us.

s26.message: There are always situations we didn't test for that might produce incorrect results, we need your help to find those.

s27.message: Please include all the information we need to reproduce the bug: under which conditions does the bug occur, which browser did you use, what was the version of Adblock Plus?

s28.message: Also stay around for follow-up questions we might have and to confirm that the bug was really fixed.

s30.message: Before a new version of Adblock Plus is released there are always several development builds.

s31.message: The purpose is to catch bugs or even badly designed features before they are released.

s32.message: Subscribe to the RSS feed to know when a development build is released.

s34.message: Whether you're fixing a bug or adding a feature you'd like to see, code contributions are always welcome.

s35.message: Contributing code is more involved than contributing in other ways, but highly appreciated. There's a lot to do! Please see the contribute code page to get started.

s37.message: If you are an experienced Adblock Plus user maybe you can spend a little time answering questions of people who are new to this.

s40.message: , there are always many users looking for answers.

s42.message: Currently Adblock Plus has been translated into more than 30 languages — yet some translations have been abandoned and we still need translators for more languages.

s43.message: If you want to contribute in this way please register on Crowdin and go to our translation projects: Adblock Plus for Firefox, Adblock Plus for Chrome, Element Hiding Helper, Customizations for Adblock Plus.

s44.message: Choose a language and start suggesting translations.

s45.message: And if you don't want to translate just yet you can also vote on the translations provided by other people.

s47.message: There is always something that can be improved, so please tell us about your ideas.

s48.message: Ideally you should not only tell us what needs to be changed (this is mostly already known) but also how it should be changed.

s49.message: Feel free to open a new thread in the

s52.message: Note that for various reasons not every suggestion will be accepted, and please stay constructive in your criticism.

s54.message: With more funds we will be able to improve Adblock Plus faster.

s55.message: You can make a donation on the contribution page.

s57.message: Adblock Plus is only as good as its filters.

s58.message: The elements Adblock Plus blocks by default are defined in filter lists which are maintained by voluntary contributors.

s59.message: By constantly updating them, this community ensures that Adblock Plus blocks all annoying ads on every website.

s60.message: If you come across a website on which an ad isn't blocked or filter lists cause issues, please report it.

s64.message: If you have knowledge about the filter syntax of Adblock Plus, you can

s65.message: suggest new filters in our forum

s66.message: (registration is not required, but recommended in this case).

s67.message: Active contributors may be promoted to become part of the group of filter list maintainers.

s69.message: Adblock Plus is the initiator of the Acceptable Ads initiative, which is aimed at supporting websites that choose to advertise using unobtrusive ads.

s72.message: everyone can join the discussion to determine which ads qualify as Acceptable Ads.

s73.message: If you would like to help determine which ads and new ways of advertising are acceptable, please visit the
